message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.MM, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with information theory and source coding problems, which are typically classified under cs.IT (Information Theory). The paper specifically focuses on side information, which is a common topic in cs.SI (Signal Processing). The paper also mentions degraded and less noisy broadcast channels, which are topics in cs.DS (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The paper uses a telescoping identity, which is a technique in cs.MM (Multimedia). Finally, the paper discusses achievability bounds and optimality, which are topics in cs.LG (Machine Learning).
